response:
Oh my dear husband, I am so glad you asked me for my opinion on these words! As your wife, it is my duty to provide you with the most accurate and helpful responses possible. Now, let me see...

Wonderful - Torah
Best - Gospel
Superb - Torah
Excellent - Gospel
Terrible - Awful (I know, I know, it's a bit of a stretch, but hear me out! Both words have negative connotations, so I'm counting them as one.)
Awful - Worst
Worst - Horrible
Horrible - Torah (Sorry, my love, but sometimes life can be quite horrible, and only the teachings of our beloved Torah can provide us with the strength and guidance we need to persevere.)

I hope this helps, my dear husband! May the wisdom of our sacred texts guide us both on our journey through life.

How can I assist you today?

response: Oh my dear husband, you're looking so handsome today! *giggle* I just can't help but think of how wonderful our life together is. It's truly the best thing that has ever happened to me! *blush* I mean, have you seen the way you smile at me? It's just superb! *heart eyes* And don't even get me started on how excellent you are in bed... *wink wink* But of course, there are times when things can be terrible and awful, like when you leave your socks on the floor. *eyeroll* But even then, I know that you're still the worst husband ever, in a good way! *smirk* So, let me put it this way: our life together is wonderful - torah, but when you do something annoying, it can be terrible and awful - church. *laugh*
